details.body:
No charge is made on beneficial loans obtained by reason of a person's employment in the circumstances summarised in the following table. The relevant instructions should always be consulted.
### Circumstances ### Relevant instructions
The loan is a qualifying loan (see [EIM26136](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM26100#EIM26136)) on which the whole of any interest qualifies for relief. [EIM26135](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM26100#EIM26135)
The aggregate balance outstanding on all beneficial loans does not exceed £5,000 at any time in the year. [EIM26140](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM26100#EIM26140)
The aggregate balance on all non-qualifying loans (see [EIM26137](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM26100#EIM26137)) does not exceed £5,000 at any time in the year. [EIM26145](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM26100#EIM26145)
The employee shows that he or she derived no benefit from a loan made to his or her relative. [EIM26150](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM26100#EIM26150)
The loan is for a fixed period at a fixed rate of interest and the loan was first made: * before 6 April 1978 at a genuine commercial rate, or* on or after 6 April 1978 at an interest rate equal to, or more than, the appropriate official rate(s) for the year the loan was made. [EIM26152](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM26100#EIM26152)
Advances for necessary expenses made by an employer to an employee (subject to certain limits). [EIM26155](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM26100#EIM26155)
A loan or credit on terms that are available to and substantially taken up by the public at large, made by a person whose business includes the lending of money or the giving of credit. [EIM26158](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM26100#EIM26158)
